campaign.story:
Inspired by Kyle Doerksen’s desire to feel like you were perpetually snowboarding the Onewheel was born. Since that fateful launch in 2014 this new passion, described by some as ‘motorized euphoria', has blossomed into its very own board sport. ‘Let My People Float’ explores the journey from an idea to what is now an exciting new board sport. Follow along as we tell the story surrounding the community, characters, and culture that make Onewheel such a phenomenon.
This is a big project and we’ve decided if we can’t tell this story professionally and in a way that represents the community as a whole, we’re not going to do it. That’s why we’re here on Kickstarter.
Stories like this are meant to be told by the people immersed in the culture. Essentially those who spend untold hours of their life riding, hosting, and engaging with the float community. Your engagement and support through Kickstarter allow us the creative freedom we need to deliver a narrative that is honest and uncensored.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge of this project is going to be traveling to gather the content. This is a global community and documenting the story correctly will require several flights. We're living in a pandemic and as of right now Americans can't even fly to several countries. This could cause delays in production, but we will do everything we can to bring the story home in the richest visual way possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My name is Angel Lopez and though I was proudly born in Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico, I have been living in San Diego for the past fourteen years. I have been tattooing professionally for twelve years. During that time, I have successfully opened, owned, and operated multiple tattoo shops that are still currently up and running. I found climbing ten years ago and though my first love is bouldering, I also enjoy a killer sport climb or multi-pitch route.
 For years, I have dreamt of finding a way to meaningfully combine my two passions: tattooing and climbing - and I finally figured it out! I initially created a tattoo special that donates 10% of quarterly profits to a rotating non-profit that directly works to preserve and maintain our beloved wild outdoor areas. As this small personal project began to take hold, I was still left plotting about how else to expand on the concept. And what better way to raise money for the outdoors then to bring sick tattoos to the hikers, climbers, bikers, and general nature-lovers done inside Tattoo Basecamp.

Interior Layout

  An Airstream Basecamp trailer turned mobile tattoo shop? It’s as simple and bitchin’ as it sounds. After endless instances of friends wanting to get tattooed out at a climbing festival or classic crag, the time has come to make the experience a reality. It is an important factor to be able to offer a clean, proper shop atmosphere regardless of terrain, location or weather. I plan on creating a registered, up-to-code, genuine tattoo shop on wheels that brings high-quality tattoos to the outdoor community around the country.









REWARDS
WOMENS TANK TOP
MENS T SHIRT
SPECIAL EDITION BANDANA
Artwork prints
WHY AIRSTREAM BASECAMP?
While planing the mobile tattoo station I’ve gone through different options to create it. From a toy hauler to a camper trailer, but none of those were a good fit for this project as the Airstream Base Camp trailer. It’s was love at first sight. Since the Interior is exactly what I needed to pass health department codes. Most camper trailers are wood interior and porous surfaces as well as the furniture fabric, and the health department requires for all tattoo shops to have non-porous walls, cabinets, countertops, and furniture including pillows.   Plus it has other things like power outlets, hand washing sink, potable water, wastewater tanks, and lighting. Leaving me with only very few things to adapt to be able to be up to code. 

WHAT’S THE PLAN?
Once funds are received, the plan is as follows:
1. Purchase the Airstream Basecamp trailer.
2. Begin build-out and conversion to a legitimate tattoo station.
3. Submit the plans to the health department.
4. Finish inspection and finalize permits to operate.
5. Rewards are printed and packaged.
  *Climbing trips projected for spring 2020.
6. Rewards are shipped to our stellar supporters.
7. Plan a route and hit the road!
WHY DO I CARE?
As so much of my inspiration for both my artwork and tattoos comes from natural spaces and climbing locations, I feel responsible to give something back to the places and community that has given so much to me.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SETBACKS

Health department permits: There’s multiple steps to be able to get the trailer fully certified and these take time.
My plan would be to have everything ready for full inspection within two months of the trailer being funded so there’s no delays and I can start traveling. I have completed this process before on a brick and mortar location and have successfully passed all the inspections with no setbacks. I’m confident this would be successful on the first go.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We spent this year redesigning the Nintendo Switch dock, making it smaller and smaller until it eventually disappeared. It's essentially an invisible dock hidden covertly in an inconspicuous, but sleek charger. 
Nintendo Switch Dock + AC Charger = Covert Dock


Let’s tackle the obvious here though. The Switch does not actually sit directly on the Covert Dock, but it does have docking capability. So how does it connect? Glad you asked: 
Step 3: Profit
You can display your game onto the big screen in its full 1080p docked mode glory with just a Covert Dock - leaving all the additional docks, chargers, and/or dongles connected at home.


One of the secrets behind making Covert Dock so powerful without the bulk is thanks to Gallium Nitride, or abbreviated to three magical letters from the periodic table, GaN:


By using the latest GaN technology, we get incredible efficiency gains that run cooler enabling us to surpass the limits of last generation silicon chargers. Take a peek inside:
It's like carrying your very own save crystal
When we say it's compact, we're pretty serious about it - we got rid of all the un-necessary bulk. It's 1/10th the size of the original dock, or put it another way, 90% smaller!
All fighters are drawn to scale

And if you compare it to the original charger alone, it's 22% smaller and does way more. We're not even including the extra space those inconvenient prongs take up when packed.  
You had one job
How else does it measure up? Well its somewhere between Genki Audio and an individual Joy-Con (without that pesky analog stick poking out).     
Countless times we wished our chargers had foldable prongs. When they stick out they snag onto things and can even scratch our precious screens. During our design, we found out that it’s really difficult to make a charger that is both small and have foldable prongs. 
You're welcome. Now you don't have to think twice about packing it.
The Covert Dock is designed for the Nintendo Switch, but it's actually quite robust and works with a lot of USB-C devices - you'll want to take it every time you leave the house.  


The tiny port on the top is basically your trusty USB-C port designed to work to the standard charging profiles of the Nintendo Switch. But unlike other chargers, it also grabs the display data from the USB-C device so that it can be processed for the HDMI display output.   Beyond just matching the Nintendo Switch charging profiles, the Covert Dock complies with the latest PD 3.0 protocols meaning you can fast charge smartphones (250% faster) and tablets, and even power hungry laptops, including the latest USB-C only MacBooks. 
Unlike other chargers that have two ports, our USB 3.1 port actually passes data as well, so you don't just charge your controllers you can actually connect your accessories whether it's a wired controller, ethernet adapter, Genki Audio, or whatever crazy accessory you're packing. It also works with tablets and computers so if you have one of the fancy systems without USB-A ports, you'll be able to hook up your flash drive, wireless mouse or a presentation clicker in a pinch.  


Getting down to the last port, we come to the world's first HDMI port built into a charger, ever.  It's designed to work with the custom display profile for the Nintendo Switch but additionally supports the DisplayPort standard so you can broadcast whatever you want, wherever you want; from showing off your latest PowerPoint presentation skills to binge watching Stranger Things (or Dark).
Covert Dock is ready to go, take it with you to your favorite bar, taco truck, dorm room, game/comic convention, hotel lounge, office meeting space, friend's house, friend's friend's house, and maybe even when visiting the family - we can't wait to see where you'll take the fun. 
When developing the passthrough charging for our previous Genki Audio adapter, we learned a lot about how power is managed by the Switch and how important it was to choose reliable components for peace of mind. 
Our engineer, Andrew wrote up a in-depth article on the causes of bricking and has even been picked up by Ars Technica, essentially it's caused by poor components overloading the  M92T36 chip which manages the docking and power of the Switch. When damaged, the Switch cannot be charged, but fortunately the chip is replaceable and your save progress is unharmed. 
To maximize reliability, we made sure not to skimp on parts. We've configured the Covert Dock to use only standard Switch charging profiles when used with the console and conform to PD standards for other USB-C devices. We've worked closely with experts in this field, including producers of the official Switch AC adapter, engineers of various docks in the market (including Insignia), and the developers behind reputable PD and GaN technologies (Navitas). 
We’ve selected premium components and are getting global certification for complete protection for you and your devices. We have a dedicated chip to manage and prevent over current/voltage production, overheating, overpowering, and short circuits. Additionally, we’ve made it possible to update the firmware so that we can maintain compatibility in the unlikely event that the Switch docking protocol changes through firmware updates and new hardware revisions.  




Here's a quick demo with Andrew demoing and Eddie kicking the trash can:  

PLAY



Together, we founded Human Things in 2017 on the idea that real objects could be special like those found in video games - you know the ones where you open treasure chests filled with enchanted items that give your character special abilities.  
We first want to thank and acknowledge Charlie, Cici, Su, and Angela for coming together last minute to review our crazy script, and through many late nights shaping it into an amazing video.
Thank you to our cast of friends and loved ones, including Jennifer, Ivette, Rory, Nathan, Ricardo, Vitor, Carmo, and Bill for sacrificing some of the nice weekend sun to help us bring this fun video to life.
Shout-outs to fra/ctal, Heck, Poon, Chack, Zak, eggnog, Doomblaze, VHS, and the rest of the competitive Smash community for helping us capture the epic party closing.
Our sincerest appreciation to Roanna and Stephanie our wonderful graphic designers who volunteered their time to really inject some fun to our Kickstarter page.
Dank u to Christian for building out and managing our European outpost in Amsterdam.
With additional thanks for our wonderful friends at WeWork Labs, Kickstarter, Stone Brewing.
And of course, we want to thank backers like you. With your crowdfunding support we’ve been able to operate as a quirky indie hardware developer free from outside investors. This means we can keep our focus on designing innovative human things we believe in without compromises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Last year we launched the most funded gaming hardware project on Kickstarter of 2018. Lots of things happened in the mean time including feature upgrades, customizations, and realizing we had to figure out how to ship a couple more thousand units than expected to 84 countries. This time, we’re even better equipped to face these challenges but no matter how much we plan there’s always a chance that things can go wrong. Whether its production, logistics, or completely random events, we promise to always share with you full transparency on our hiccups and resolve them in a way that keeps our backers happy and proud to keep supporting Genki.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just a reminder:
For all shipping inquiries, please read this update and for additional info please email shipping@humanthings.co using the email address registered with Backerkit (tracking updates are slower than normal, we've seen post offices update them even after packages have arrived so please do give it a solid week before reaching out to us for this)
For all other inquiries, please send an email to genki@humanthings.co and make sure you include your Backerkit email (it's difficult to track with comments)

updates.update_userinfo: We could all use an island getaway right about now
updates.update_content:
As the world is changing quicker than we can keep up, we want to reach out and extend our hand to remind you that we are all in this together. Our thoughts out to those who are in the hardest hit hotspots. This current crisis only amplifies our belief that regardless of where you live, the types of games you enjoy or the color of your joy-cons – we are inextricably connected to each other. 
Our team has taken to working remotely for the past few weeks and being at home with family, and it may have taken a global pandemic to remind us, allowing us to pause and reflect on what matters. While some of us just can’t wait for Animal Crossing to come out, or are spending time getting in shape with the family over Ringfit, or like me, trying to finally tackle that backlog of games piling up through these past few busy sprints.

updates.update_userinfo: An Update on Supply Chain Disruptions
updates.update_content:
Since our last update we’ve had a major roadblock - many of you by now have heard of the COVID-19 virus. Its delayed Outer World’s release on the Switch, the Animal Crossing Switch console, and unfortunately has impacted several of our key component suppliers. We’ve been working hard over the past weeks trying to get a grip and assess the complete impact and decide on a best course of action. We're really sorry for these delays, and know that a lot of you are super excited to get your hands on this for your next trip.
What's happening on the ground

First things first, happy holidays. We know we're a little late on shipment and that a lot of you are traveling which would've made this the perfect gaming companion especially if you're visiting family. We sincerely apologize for the delay, pioneering new categories of devices always takes some time, and the Pareto 80/20 principle applies here, that 80% of the effort was done in 20% of the time but the last 20% is what is taking 80% of the time. We seriously hate being late as we really originally targeted finishing up late November but alas even the most well made plans don't always succeed. As we know more we'll be sure to update as soon as possible, January will be a really really busy month for us.
Surveys are making a splash this week

Woohoo! Covert Dock is a Go!
Thanks to the support of this Kickstarter community, we can continue to make awesome products for elevated play experiences. We developed this because of our love for gaming and we’re glad this resonates with everyone here.  Last year our Genki Audio was the most funded gaming hardware project of 2018 and we're happy to carry the tradition forward with the Covert Dock. This is by far our biggest undertaking and we've actually become the most funded gaming hardware Kickstarter project since the Oculus Rift set the bar back in 2012.

project_data.project_name: GENKI: Covert Dock for the Nintendo Switch

campaign.story:
Pluto Wireless is a unique wireless power bank and a minimalist design object, delivering a powerfully fast energy to go (10W). Designed for an intuitive use this product is a divine statement about bringing order to complexity.
 The device is compatible with iPhone and Samsung Fast Charge, working with a wide range of brands, including Samsung, Sony, LG, Nokia, Microsoft, Google and more. Among iPhones, the charger works with iPhone Xs/X, iPhone Xs Max, iPhone XR, iPhone 8 Plus, and iPhone 8.
Here is the really smart thing that only Pluto Wireless does. wireless reverse charging is a breakthrough technology, allowing Pluto Wireless to charge itself wirelessly when you place it at a Wireless Charging Base. Simplicity at its best.
Pluto Wireless can charge through phone cases up to 3mm thick, so there’s no need to pull your case on and off every time you want to charge.
Pluto Wireless has taken craftsmanship to new levels, following the curves of the design right up to elegant corners. Made with the essentials of good design, the device uses premium aluminum blended with luxurious fabric and high-end technology for a seamless, fast charging experience. The fabric is specially engineered to resist scratches, and colors and materials chosen after research to reflect light for the most appealing looks. Assembly without the use of screws lends the device an exceptional touch and feel.
 Charge using the USB-A port while another device charges wirelessly.
  Technically, Pluto Wireless satisfied strict standard expected of today’s gadgets. The case is 100% aluminum and comprises a 10,000mAh Lithium Polymer cell with 10W wireless output. Protection against overheating, overcharge, and surge protection is in-built. The device carries USB-C and USB-A ports, and features a cool LED charging indicator. An additional feature is priority charging, which allows the phone to be charged first and not the device when it is plugged into an adapter.
GREEN DESIGN — We innovate using biodegradable and recyclable packaging material that allow us to take care of the planet. 
 Want to write about PLUTO WIRELESS Download our Press Pack!

campaign.story:
Hey Kickstarters!! It's Dave from Thread&Leather, back with my new business partner Lily (who also happens to be my sister) five years after successfully launching the Wrap Wallet right here on Kickstarter. We're excited to bring you two amazing new products: the Thread&Leather Clutch and the Half-Wrap Wallet.
Thread&Leather Clutch - Simple, but not basic
We've spent the last year creating the ultimate take-anywhere clutch, designed to hold all your essentials in one spot. Durable for everyday use, yet stylish enough for date night.
The Clutch also works great for keeping all your travel documents and currency organized, so you don't lose anything important while rushing through security to catch your flight.
The Clutch is 7.75" wide by 4.5" tall, perfectly sized to hold everything you need and bring with you everywhere.
Thread&Leather Half-Wrap - Maximum minimalism
We at Thread&Leather are extremely proud of the Wrap Wallet. Over 12,000 customers agree that it is the best wallet in the world. It is as small as possible while remaining fully-functional. It is so good that it was recently awarded U.S. Utility Patent #10,080,407.
However, we keep getting requests for an even smaller wallet for minimalists, people who don't carry cash, and people who want something ultra sleek for going out at night. So we took the best parts of the Wrap Wallet, the credit card pocket on the inside and the slide pocket on the outside, and combined them into the Half-Wrap.
There's enough room to hold 6 cards between the two pockets, with a few bills folded up inside, just in case. It also makes an amazing business card wallet, holding 10 business cards in the main pocket, with your hotel key easily accessible in the slide pocket.
Materials & Construction
Like the Wrap Wallet, the Clutch and Half-Wrap are made in the USA, laser-cut from premium, locally-produced goat leather. We hand-sew every wallet with the finest French waxed-linen thread using the saddle stitch, which is stronger than any machine sewing method. We pride ourselves on the details & quality. See for yourself!!
After testing dozens of closure options, we found the perfect magnetic clasp for the Clutch. It is simple, secure, feels great to open and close, and the stitching detail looks amazing!!
Every product we make is bespoke, sewn to customer specifications. You have your choice of seven colors of leather and five colors of thread, for 35 total color combinations.
Leather Colors
Thread Colors
Color Combinations
Here are a few of our favorite color combinations. You'll be able to select your personal color combination after project funding closes. Creativity is encouraged!!
Half-Wraps in British Tan & Green, Rich Mahogany & Ecru, All-Natural & Red, and Jet Black on Black
Clutches in Jet Black on Black, British Tan & Green, and Ferrari Red on Red
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter project has its risks. We learned this the hard way after our first project exploded in popularity, and a few loose ends were lost along the way. But that was five years ago, and since then we've built a streamlined system where wallets are laser-cut, hand-sewn, and shipped around the world every business day. All of our production happens in-house, and we'll be using the excess capacity our business has after the holiday rush is over to begin producing and shipping the Clutch and Half-Wrap right after the project ends.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
2 years ago, we brought you The World's Smallest EDC Flashlight. We wanted to shake up the Everyday Carry market by providing awesome, minimal products everyone can use on a day-to-day basis. Introducing NanoPen, the pen that goes where you go.
When we say "World's Smallest", we mean it. Measuring in at a staggering 5cm in length, and 0.75cm in diameter, nothing else on the market comes close with the portability we offer.   
It's pretty F*CKING strong. Try to break it if you can. 
This material is superior because it is particularly resistant to deforming. It's Mohs Hardness is rated at 9 which is higher than Titanium and Steel.  
Using a Tungsten Carbide tip, this pen is more than just a writing instrument. We've tested the NanoPen thoroughly to ensure that it is a perfect EDC tool for the toughest tasks.
Have a neat idea? Sketch it out with ease. Fill out forms on the go. Puncture bothersome plastic packaging. Heck, even cut open all those Amazon boxes- The options are endless.  
The tungsten carbide ball is designed to be a perfect sphere that can grip any writing surface. Its surface is actually composed of over 50,000 polished surfaces and pits connected by a series of channels throughout the entire sphere. This design allows the ink to be present on both the surface and interior of the ball.  
At Slughaus we believe in pushing boundaries and elevating overall design & functionality in peoples lives. It's more than just a pen that fits on your keys, its a simpler way of living.  
The earliest design we have of a pen dates back to the late 1800's. These pens smudged easily and would leak, voiding them unusable. Fast forward to 1945, the ballpoint pen design we know today was perfected and patented.
In 2018 we like doing things differently, making the traditional ballpoint pen sleek and minimal, for you to carry ANYWHERE effortlessly.  
When we say take your EDC further, we mean take it with you anywhere and everywhere. We aren't a traditional Every Day Carry brand. We like to get creative and give new meaning to the way you carry things.
   Hook it on to your backpack, duffel, or keychain to ensure you never forget a pen when you're traveling on-the-go.
Add it to your favorite jacker zipper, and utilize it as a zipper pull.  
Need less bulk on your Keys? Add it to a traditional ballchain and wear it as a necklace.  
Never lose your pen again.   
      They say that size doesn't always matter. But it does when it comes to EDC.  
     We've considered every possible aspect of the NanoPen from the size ratio of the key ring to body, to the finish of the metal to ensure proper grip when in use. We started from a standard pen and reduced it to an extremely minimal design, while giving it infinite function.
In order to perfect the NanoPen we had to go through various vigorous testing and revision. We worked with multiple pen manufactures to ensure our design was perfected to be the best tiny ballpoint pen on the market. Truly, there's nothing out there like it.  
   SLUGHAUS is a small company based out of San Francisco with the sole mission of helping you stay minimal and functional. We believe that your everyday carry essentials influence your lifestyle. NanoPen's elegance inspires innovation, while its functionality keeps you on-the-go. We hope that our products not only help keep you minimal, but help mold your lifestyle as a whole.
MEDIA KIT HERE

campaign.story:
HyperDrive is a 8-in-1 USB-C Hub
New HyperDrive USB-C Hub with integrated retractable cable turns a single USB-C port into 8 ports (4K HDMI, Gigabit Ethernet, microSD, SD, 3 x USB 3.1 and USB-C Power Delivery). Update: Cable will be detachable so you can use a longer cable if you wish. 
That is also a 7.5W Wireless Charger for the iPhone
Using the latest Qi wireless charging standard that supports 7.5W high speed iPhone 8/X wireless charging. Also supports 5/10/15W high speed Android wireless charging.
And a convertible iPhone Stand
Wirelessly charge your iPhone flat or while standing up, in landscape or portrait mode with a convertible iPhone stand that does not interfere with your swipe gestures. HyperDrive has not 1 but 3 wireless charging coils to ensure that there are no wireless charging blind spots.
With unlimited adjustable viewing angles
High quality hinges (used in laptops) allow for unlimited adjustable viewing angles
Power HyperDrive Wireless Charger with your computer or with a standalone USB-C charger (nightstand mode)
Use the built-in retractable USB-C cable to connect HyperDrive Hub + Wireless Charger to the computer. Connect separate USB-C power to HyperDrive to provide power delivery to the computer or to operate HyperDrive as a standalone wireless charger (e.g. nightstand)
HyperDrive in the News
9to5mac - "Hyper unveils USB-C hub w/ built-in 7.5W Qi wireless charger & stand"
The Verge - "This is a very good idea. The HyperDrive USB-C hub / wireless charging stand might be the perfect desk accessory"
Cult of Mac - "The HyperDrive hub is a MacBook owner’s dream"
BGR - "This is the Macbook dongle to end all dongles"
GStyle Magazine - "The Hyperdrive 8-in-1 is the hub you need for everything"
CNET - "Dongle doubles up for USB-C and wireless iPhone charging"
Mac Rumours - "Hyper Launches 8-in-1 USB-C Hub With Built-In 7.5W Wireless Charger"
Geeky Gadgets - "HyperDrive iPhone Wireless Charger And USB-C Hub Hits Kickstarter"
ubergizmo - "The HyperDrive Is A USB-C Hub With Qi Wireless Charging"
Android Community - "HyperDrive USB-C hub is an 8-in-1 dongle for your computer"
New Atlas - "HyperDrive USB-C hub adds wireless smartphone charging and 8 extra ports to your laptop"
9to5mac - "Hyper’s combo 8-in-1 USB-C Hub + 7.5W Qi wireless charger & iPhone stand goes up for preorder"
iLounge - "Hyper reveals Kickstarter preview for HyperDrive hub with built-in wireless iPhone charging stand"
Android Police - "HyperDrive is a combo USB-C hub, stand, and Qi charger on Kickstarter (and it's already funded)"
New Design!
PLAY

HyperDrive is now thinner & sleeker with the same length, width & design lines as the iPhone X.
As mentioned at the start of this Kickstarter campaign, we are removing the built-in USB cable and making it detachable so that users can use a longer cable if they wish. As a very positive result of removing this built-in cable, we are able to make significant improvements to the design.
First and foremost, the HyperDrive will be much thinner and sleeker looking now, with the same length, width and design lines as the iPhone X. The charging USB-C port is also now moved to the back of the HyperDrive for better cable management when the HyperDrive is used as a standalone wireless charger.
5 Reasons why HyperDrive is better than other wireless chargers 
1) 7.5W Wireless Charging
Almost all Qi wireless chargers currently in the market are the 5W, 10W or 15W variety designed for Android Smartphones which may not work well with the iPhone or charge the iPhone very slowly at less than 5W.
HyperDrive is the only wireless charger that supports all 4 Qi wireless charging standards (7.5W, 5W, 10W and 15W)
HyperDrive supports the latest Qi wireless charging standard including 7.5W high speed wireless charging optimized for the iPhone as well as 5/10/15W high speed wireless charging of Android smartphones.
Better and faster than mophie and Belkin wireless chargers sold by Apple
HyperDrive is the only wireless charger that supports 5/7.5/10/15W Qi standard
HyperDrive takes 2h58m to full charge iPhone X from empty, faster than mophie & Belkin
HyperDrive is the World's 1st wireless charging stand with LCD voltage/current display
HyperDrive supports both USB QC and USB-C PD input which supports firmware update while mophie/Belkin uses DC input which does not support firmware update
HyperDrive has a built-in USB-C hub with 3 x USB power output (5V1.5A)
HyperDrive has not 1 but 3 charging coils to allow iPhone to charge in any position
2) Lower Temperature
Traditional Qi wireless chargers generate too much heat which may cause the iPhone to shut down
Traditional Qi wireless chargers are not very efficient and generate a lot of heat which causes the iPhone to reduce or stop charging completely to lower operating temperature.
iPhone 8/X will charge wirelessly at 
7.5W at temperatures below 36.5ºC/97.7ºF
5W at temperatures between 36.5ºC/97.7ºF and 38ºC/100.4ºF
3W at temperatures between 38ºC/100.4ºF and 40ºC/104ºF
0W (stop charging) at temperatures above 40ºC/104ºF
HyperDrive is a low temperature device and insulates the iPhone from any little heat it generates so that it can charge properly
HyperDrive uses power efficient components and is designed to be a low temperature (25ºC/77ºF) device. Whatever little heat generated is dissipated from the aluminum sides and is isolated from the iPhone by an air gap and insulator convertible stand layer.
3) Fixed frequency that does not interfere with Touch and Face ID
Traditional Qi wireless chargers may emit frequencies that interfere with Touch or Face ID
Traditional Qi wireless chargers are made with low cost materials that have fluctuating electromagnetic frequencies that may interfere with iPhone functions like Touch & FaceID.
HyperDrive uses a fixed frequency designated by Apple that does not interfere with Touch or Face ID
HyperDrive uses a fixed wireless charging frequency designated by Apple and is guaranteed to work perfectly with the iPhone.
4) Firmware upgradeable
As HyperDrive uses USB-C input instead of DC input (Belkin/mophie). It is currently the only iPhone wireless charger in the market that is firmware upgradeable to support new features like faster iPhone wireless charging speeds in the future.
5) Award winning USB-C hub
Besides being a great wireless charger, HyperDrive also incorporates award winning USB-C hub capabilities that raised over $3.1 million on Kickstarter and Indiegogo and has hundreds of positive reviews with an average 4 star rating on Amazon and BestBuy.
Despite its features and having a USB-C hub, HyperDrive is no bigger than the ordinary wireless charger sold in the Apple Store
And is actually thinner than the most popular Android wireless charger on the market
A single HyperDrive replaces $250 worth of separate accessories
But you can get HyperDrive USB-C Hub + 7.5W Wireless Charger for as low as $79
Rewards 
Early Bird Special (50% off) 
$79 - 1 x HyperDrive 
$158 - 2 x HyperDrive 
$237 - 3 x HyperDrive 
$395 - 5 x HyperDrive 
$790 - 10 x HyperDrive 
Kickstarter Special ($50 off)
$109 - 1 x HyperDrive

$1090 - 10 x HyperDrive 
Expected Retail Price
$159 - 1 x HyperDrive 
$318 - 2 x HyperDrive 
$477 - 3 x HyperDrive 
$795 - 5 x HyperDrive
$1590 - 10 x HyperDrive 
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
Reward Fulfillment
To ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service from 2 fulfillment and distribution centers in:
California USA - fulfilling rewards within the United States  
Hong Kong - fulfilling rewards to the rest of the world 
Fulfilment managed via BackerKit
Project Timeline
15 January 2018 - Kickstarter begins 
19 February 2018 - Kickstarter ends 
February 2018 - Production begins 
April 2018 - Shipping of Early Bird rewards 
May 2018 - Shipping of Kickstarter Special rewards
Specifications
 Output:
- HDMI supporting 1080p@60Hz, 4K@30Hz
- Gigabit Ethernet
- SD (UHS-I 104MB/s)
- micro SD (UHS-I 104MB/s)
- 3 x USB 3.1 Gen 1 (5Gb/s)
- USB-C 60W power delivery pass through charging 
Input: 1 x USB-C 
Wireless Charging: 5/7.5/10/15W Qi Standard 
Number of Wireless Charging Coils: 3
DC/DC efficiency: Up to 96% 
Device Operating Temperature: 25ºC / 77ºF 
Enclosure: Aluminum & ABS 
Dimensions: 5.1" x 3.7" x 1" / 130 x 94 x 25.8 mm 
Weight: 7.2 oz / 0.45 lb / 204g
Design Story
The initial idea of this product was to combine a Qi wireless charger with a USB-C hub and make it as compact as possible. For our first design, we decide to take the ubiquitous flat round Qi wireless charging pad, add some thickness to it to accommodate USB-C hub elements. However a perfect circle is not a very efficient shape for laying out electronic components. We also explored a perfect square design but it was too utilitarian. We finally decided on an organic design with rounded edges. When we wanted to add a convertible phone stand tray to our rounded square prototype, we realized that tray was too short to stably support a phone in portrait position. Hence we came up with the final design which is a cross between a rounded rectangle and an oval which provided a stand tall enough to stably support a phone in portrait mode. The additional space also allowed us to have not 1 but 3 wireless charging coils, an LCD display panel and compartment to for the built-in cable to stowaway.
Proof of Concept 
PLAY

The above unedited video demonstrates a fully functional pre-production HyperDrive with all ports working (2 x USB 3.1 hard drives, USB-C Power Delivery, Gigabit Ethernet, HDMI display, microSD, SD and USB flash drive). HyperDrive is also shown to provide pass through power delivery to the 15" MacBook Pro as well as wirelessly charge the iPhone X at 7.5W (5V, 1.5A) in multiple positions. HyperDrive is plug-n-play and interfaces directly with Mac OS or Windows. Plugging devices into HyperDrive is like plugging directly to the computer. On Mac OS, video displays are controlled by Mac OS System Preferences > Displays. Power delivery by Mac OS System Preferences > Energy Saver. External storage are controlled by Mac OS Finder.
About us
HYPER by Sanho Corporation has been making award winning Apple accessories since 2009. We also have a long proven track record of delivering Kickstarter and Indiegogo projects. Our latest Kickstarter and Indiegogo project, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro, raised over $3.1 million and is currently the most crowdfunded MacBook and USB-C accessory. Our first Kickstarter project, CloudFTP, was the 3rd most funded Kickstarter technology project when funding ended and named by Stuff Magazine as one of the “10 best Kickstarter technology projects”. Our 2nd Kickstarter project, iStick, raised over $1.1 million and was one of the 50 most funded Kickstarter project when funding ended. This is our 11th crowdfunding project. Our previous crowdfunding projects, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro Kickstarter, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro Indiegogo, CloudFTP, iStick, HyperLink, iShowFast, Pearl Kickstarter, Pearl Indiegogo, iPin for iPhone/Android, iPin for iPhone, HyperDrive for MacBook and HyperJuice for MacBook have altogether raised over $5 million.
Get Your Project Funded Today!
Pledge and Support Us Now!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No project is without risk and challenges but we try to do our absolute best to minimize them. We felt that we have done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Kickstarter. We are also no strangers to USB-C products, Apple accessories or crowdfunding.

The HyperDrive product that you see in the above video/photos are actual working prototypes.

With your support, we can bring HyperDrive to iPhone and MacBook Pro users worldwide. We have started mass production and your contribution will help us achieve economies of scale and keep the product cost low.

We have sufficient materials to manufacture about 5,000 units now. Beyond that, the lead time is about a month. Your strong support will give us the needed affirmation to place a larger raw materials order and start mass production earlier.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A climbing film about women, by women, for everyone. 
This isn’t a film about gender imbalance or the sexualization of women or what it’s like to have your period at the crag. This is a film about 5 of the best climbers in the world doing what they do best: crushing. Pretty Strong will follow 5 female climbers* around the world as they explore new climbing areas, find projects, and push the boundaries of our sport.
This film is for every climber stuck on the couch recovering from an injury. This film is for that little girl who just started climbing, to show her that the climbing world is a place for her. This film is for the climber looking for that last nudge of inspiration to get off their ass and go to the gym. If you’re a climber, this film is for you.
*There are dozens of climbers we are considering for this project, but the final selection will depend on climbing objectives, funding, athlete schedules, and our production schedule. As we get more of these things confirmed, we will update you on who we are planning to include. Comment below on who you would like to see featured!
**Shoutout to good friend, designer, motion graphics artist, and creative genius Bryan Nanista for our badass Never Not Collective end card. Check out more of his work at http://www.bryanjnanista.com/ or on Instagram @bnanista.
What was the first major climbing film you ever saw? What about the most recent one? Chances are if you’ve turned on a climbing film in the last 18 years, you’ve seen male climbers dominating the screen. With more women climbers than ever, the numbers weren't adding up, so we did some research. 
Nina Williams on the Southwest Arete (5.9). Photo: Colette McInerney
Out of 91 main segments in high production climbing films, there have been 8 segments that feature a female climber as the main character (and the same woman was the subject in three of those). Out of the 91 segments, 11 showed a woman climbing…but her part was a supplement to the main story about one or more male climbers. Out of the six narrative-style feature films we looked at, none have had a female climber as the lead character.
Emily Harrington on 'Tom Et Je Ris' (8b+/5.14a), Verdon Gorge, France. Photo: Colette McInerney
...And we want to see more women making media.
Not only are the climbing films being made today mostly featuring men on screen, but they are predominantly being created by men. We're hoping to foster a community and network of female media makers through Never Not (with this project and future ones). We want to build relationships with established female camera operators, editors, composers, animators, etc., and create opportunities for women who are new to outdoor media. 
Below is a breakdown of the Pretty Strong budget. We are planning on getting half of our funding from Kickstarter and the other half from brand partners. 
        We are videographers, writers, photographers, and most importantly, climbers. With climbing films for inspiration, all four of us longed for movies that put female climbers front and center. As we developed individually as creatives and eventually founded this all-women's production team, we realized: We should make the film we've always wanted to see.
Started by four unapologetic women of the outdoors, Never Not Collective seeks to tell the stories of everyday people doing great things, brave things, things that are challenging, engaging, and gratifying—regardless of “success.” Action is exciting, but we believe that people, with all their complexity, faults, and flaws, are at the heart of every compelling story. Our deep commitment to collaboration stems from diverse backgrounds in writing, photography, video, multimedia, and analytics. This fusion of unique perspectives helps Never Not create refreshing content that connects with a wide variety of viewers. 
COLETTE MCINERNEY After a decade of traveling the world as a professional climber, Colette started recording her adventures through photography and film in 2010. She found her passion at the intersection of photo, film, travel, and climbing, and since then she’s worked with companies like Red Bull, National Geographic, Prana, and New Balance to capture the story behind the biggest accomplishments. From summiting 14,000-foot peaks to scaling massive limestone walls, she can—and will—go anywhere to get the shot.
JULIE ELLISON As Climbing magazine’s first female Editor in Chief, Julie has spent a quarter of her life writing, shooting, and editing stories about climbing and the outdoors. With a genuine documentary style, her stories use adventure as a way to experience the world and help the people in it. She’s written about the refugee crisis on the island of Kalymnos, a climbing camp for cancer survivors, and seeing death firsthand in Mexico. In 2017, the OR Daily named her one of the 26 Most Talented People in the Outdoor Industry.
SHELMA JUN Shelma is a sucker for a good story. Whether it’s documenting cyclists of color in NYC or building a temporary community art park in the Lower East Side, she focuses on bringing people together and sharing their stories. She is the founder of Flash Foxy, a multi-media platform that celebrates women in climbing, and the creator of the Women’s Climbing Festival, a weekend of climbing, panels, and clinics. In 2017, she was named one of 40 women who’ve made the biggest impact in the outdoor world by Outside Magazine.
LESLIE HITTMEIER Working as an editor at Skiing Magazine, a managing editor at Teton Gravity Research, and a freelance photographer, Leslie became a fixture in skiing media before joining Never Not Collective as the group’s token young gun. She’s traveled to Chile, Japan, France, Jamaica, and all over the American West to document badass skiers, climbers, and adventurers in their natural habitats. As an obsessed skier and climber herself, Leslie plays and trains in her home mountain range of the Tetons.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are trying to make a feature-length film about climbing. We know there are so many things that can go wrong, like athlete injury, bad weather, unexpected production costs, scheduling difficulty, and the high price of licensing a dope Rihanna song. But we are confident that with our diverse skill set and experience in media production we are prepared to deal with those challenges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We all remember and love the MagSafe connector on Mac. However the new MacBooks now have USB-C power jacks. It's just not the same anymore.
 And we hope to bring an even better magnetic connector to your laptop.
So we would like to bring you the “Snapnator". And look how simple and convenient it is to use.
Don't let your laptop get yanked to the floor.
It doesn't matter which way you connected, right side up or upside down.
The Snapnator has even greater magnetic coupling then the traditional MagSafe connector.
Most magnetic couplings, have a magnet on one side and iron on the other side. With the snap we spared no expense. We put a magnet on both sides.
Our adapter is the sleekest and smallest magnetic adapter ever made. Because our adapter works for USB type C, it will work for all your USB type C devices. Now magnetic power connectors are available for PC devices and even many phones.
Snapnator on MacBook Pro 2016 13"
Kickstarter backers get an additional 6 months of warranty beyond the standard 12 month warranty available to post-Kickstarter buyers. Get yours now.
Additional 6 months of warranty for Kickstarter backers!
We provide worldwide shipping for our backers.
For select rewards, our Kickstarter backers will receive a USB-C to USB adapter and USB-C Hub
USB-C Hub and USB-C adapter
PLAY

Using Snapnator w/ OnePlus 3
 Snapnator on MacBook Pro 2016 13"
PLAY

 Snapnator on MacBook Pro 2016 15"
PLAY

As you can see, Snapnator charges at the same speed as the original cable. You can enjoy the snap feature without losing anything.
Check the Full Length Unedited Video on ->>Snapnator YouTube Channel
4 Color Options for Snapnator: Silver, Gold, Space Grey, Rose Gold
https://www.facebook.com/SnapnatorDesign/
                                                                      https://twitter.com/snapnator
https://www.reddit.com/submit
We are a group of engineers that have contract manufactured magnetic connectors for a number of other brands in the past. However this time we have developed a truly unique connector and are launching this product under our own name.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We understand the risks and challenges that all startup companies face in the electronics industry. While we may be considered a startup when it comes to branding our product, we are not not exact newbies. We have been working behind other brands and manufacturing for them. With this in mind we know that we already have the resources necessary to manufacture but we just need the help of the backers to kickstart this project. 
In our experience in the manufacturing for other brands we know that the most important thing we can do is to keep an open line of communication no matter what and that is something we can provide our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
After we send out our last update (until 2018.06.03), we have 693 backers chose our new product (A), while 72 backers selected the old products (B) and provided us their detailed receipt information. All products have been shipped and the tracking numbers have been sent to your email. We believe that the product will soon be delivered to you.
We know that there are still a few backers who have not made a choice yet. Please email us at service@snapnator.com as soon as possible and tell us your options: A. Choosing a new product and you will get a coupon code; B. Choosing an old product may require you to fill in the form about your latest receipt information (Note: If the information is not complete, it is likely that you may not receive your product). We will deal with this information within 48 hours. Thank you so much for supporting our new product!

Dear Backers,
We have delivered all packages and replied the tracking number to whom provide us the correct information yesterday, no matter you choose option A or option B. We believe your package will arrived soon.

We have some exciting news. We have hired another engineer who has assisted us to make an even better cable converter. As you know, the original cable converter design could only do charging. We are now able to manufacture our magnetic connectors in a way that not only supports the charging but also supports all the data functionality of the cable. We believe that this cable converter will be even more reliable than our original and because of its data function capabilities we have created extra accessories that work with it.
• Compatible with all USB-C MacBooks and other Type C devices.

Dear Backers,  
Good news is we collected another 1371 backers since last month. So far almost 70% of the backers have received their back items. The rest are on the way, we believe soon the snapnators will arrive you.

Dear Backers,
We would like to update you all that we have currently shipped out 6000 units of Snapnator while there are still 3355 units are pending. We just received all units from our manufacturer today. We are doing our best to inspect them as fast as we can and get them shipped. We hope to be able to ship 2000 within November and the remainder before the Christmas season arrives.

updates.update_userinfo: We are just resending these orders
updates.update_content: We are just re sending these orders, please check if you are in the new list. The tracking number is included at final column in the list. Please track your parcel through www.17track.net, For those who are still waiting for the receiving, please confirm the shipping status with our online representative through www.snapnator.com or write to service@snapnator.com Check list visit https://www.facebook.com/SnapnatorDesign/photos/a.1791385357742460.1073741828.1788798588001137/1945599345654393/…

Dear Backers:
It has recently came to our attention, that some possibly malicious entities are running a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo for what they claim to be Snapnator, with the content of their crwodfunding page thoroughly plagiarized from ours. Needless to say we have reported this to Indiegogo-we have no association with any people behind it and we have never raised funds on any platform other than Kickstarter.

Dear Backers:
As we upgraded our service infrastructure yesterday to enable the notification of tracking numbers, we experienced disruption that led to our service Email addresses becoming unavailable, everything should be back to normal now. We are sorry for the inconvenience it may have caused.
Best regards,

Dear Backers,
The shipping process is well underway with most of your goods packaged and transported to our cargo company, where they will be labelled and weighed individually and dispatched. To deal with the complex custom situation in many nations, especially to not request addition private information from you unnecessarily(many nations we ship to ask for recipients' personal VAT numbers for all non-postal packages), we send most of your rewards via postal packages, while they do take a while to cross the oceans, the avoidance of unpredictable delays and hiccups at the customs is arguably worth it. We are also progressing on improving the currently still manual tracking number query system that we mentioned in one of the previous posts, hopefully in the next week we are able to show you something.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Progress and Clarification about the Accessories
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers:
Since our shipping started, we have been flooded with comments and emails of you guys/gals sharing your experience and stories with your snapnators, and we found them deeply encouraging and motivating. We are all committed to bring back Magsafe to the Macbooks through our effort, and seeing them in action in the world outside of our company is just an incredible experience. We also owe a big "thank you" to those of you who offer us constructive criticisms, which would be very helpful in our further improvement of snapnator.

campaign.story:
Cream/Blue (left), Grey/Blue (right), and Navy Blue/Light Cream (below) Libre Sweaters. Currently available at the $99* EARLYISH BIRD perk ($139.95 retail price), $198* for two, or $285* for all three. *Does not include shipping.
        Made in Bolivia with llama fiber, the Libre Sweater is our answer to the garment that doesn’t exist any more—a beautiful, rugged knit engineered to be put through the wringer, day after day. It keeps you comfortable, invites you to push yourself, and maintains that classic, heritage-inspired look, wherever you happen to roam. 
            We started with a tailored, unisex silhouette for the Libre, and then added raglan sleeves for enhanced mobility. In other words, no restriction while reaching for a climbing hold, zero bunching while stretched out over the handlebars, and no pull while lifting the coffee mug. For the front panel and arms, we’ve employed a buttery-soft, midweight llama knit for year-round wear. We engineered an innovative, breathable knit mesh for the back panel, helping to regulate body temperature by releasing excess heat and moisture vapor. Say goodbye to sweaty back syndrome. Additionally, we beefed up the ribbing on the neck, cuffs, and hem to eliminate the dreadful stretching and sagging that plagues most woolen tops. We then rounded out the design by adding double-reinforced seams throughout to ensure it stands up the loads of use and abuse we encourage you to dish out. 
The Libre pays homage to the early wool-wearing boundary pushers—vikings, sailors, climbers, alpinists, skiers, writers, and other trailblazers who did things their way. After all, the wool sweater is one of the original technical midlayers, and we recognize it as a symbol of freedom that invites, and challenges, us to push ourselves to do things our way. 
  The story starts with the llama—that noble, dependable pack animal that’s been providing a way of life for people in the Bolivian Andes for thousands of years. Llamas are adapted to this high plains region, where 50-degree temperature swings can occur daily, and their hollow hair serves as the perfect form of natural insulation. It’s proven to effectively trap warm air, insulate when wet, create a natural wind block, in addition to being naturally hypoallergenic, elastic, strong, and soft to the touch. This made it the perfect choice for the foundation of our Libre project.
    Additionally, llama fiber is sourced with minimal effects on the environment, and the sale of llama fiber acts as a source of income for thousands of families in the Andes. We’re working closely with these farmers and manufacturers to develop a supply chain that focuses on the animals’ well-being, improves people’s lives, and minimizes our impact on the environment. Members of our team regularly visit suppliers to ensure that we’re creating a lasting, positive impact on communities in the region by responsibly sourcing the fiber that goes into our products.
               We’ve partnered with a team in Bolivia for our fiber, which is one of the few companies in the world that’s developed an innovative dehairing process to separate coarse llama hair from fine hair. It’s based on the same principles used for dehairing cashmere, yielding the finest fibers possible for its “Cashmere of the Andes.” This fiber is then knitted to our specs to create the highly insulating, comfortable, and durable Libre sweater.
Transparency and camaraderie stand at the center of this company, with a group of employees that has grown into a family within a superb working environment and excellent working conditions. 
The group we've partnered with proudly holds social and environmental sustainability as the company’s core values. Its strong commitment to social responsibility is evident throughout the company’s practices and production processes: 
It is WRAP (Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production) certified. 
All workers receive health and retirement benefits, paid vacation, and double pay for overtime. 
It provides food subsidies to factory workers. 
Ergonomic chairs for all of its workers. 
Close to 80% of its workforce are women; many of whom are the sole providers of their households. 
Preservation of Bolivia’s strong heritage of knitting by providing job opportunities through this trade. 
The use fiber dyes with low environmental impact. 
A water treatment plant has been mounted by its sister company and yarn provider to treat the production’s water residues. 
Low-carbon emissions through the use of natural gas as our main source for heating. 
The use of biodegradable plastic bags for shipping. 
      All our products are Guaranteed For Good. Your product is guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. 
If your product does not meet your expectations in any way, we’ll work with you to resolve the issue, whether that means returning the item for repair, replacing or exchanging it, or refunding your purchase.
  Davis Smith is a member of the UN Foundation’s Global Entrepreneurs Council. He was previously the Co-CEO of Baby.com.br, Brazil's startup of the year in 2012. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University (BA), the University of Pennsylvania's Lauder Institute (MA) and Wharton School (MBA). Davis is a lover of the outdoors and recently lead a team on the first successful crossing from Cuba to Florida via kayak.
Prior to joining Cotopaxi, Cheri designed technical apparel for top brands across the outdoor industry, such as Marmot, Columbia Sportswear and Dakine. She’s also a patent-holding shoe designer with designs at Nike ID and Ariat. Growing up on a sunny California farm, she fell in love with the outdoors. Today, she gets her fix skiing Utah’s famous snow, hiking with her dog Ned, or looking for the next wave on her kiteboard. Cheri holds a BA in Product Design and Development from San Francisco State University.
Spread the word! Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Cotopaxi.

updates.update_content:
Happy Wednesday Backers!
We wanted to send another quick update to share what's going on at Cotopaxi and with your sweaters.
Our CX team has had an increase in support requests with our Questival event series in full force, and as such are playing a little catch up on emails to llamas@cotopaxi.com and Kickstarter requests since Friday. We've been holding interviews to bring on more help the past couple days, but wanted to let you know that there may be a delay in our support team getting back to you. They'll get back to you as soon as they can.

Hello Backers!
We wanted to update you regarding the changes with Libre shipments, huzzah!
We hope that all of you who have received your sweaters love them! If you are still waiting for your sweater, we are SO sorry, and we thank you profusely for your patience and understanding with these changes in fulfillment dates. Our factory partners in Bolivia have been working hard, but have not been able to keep up with the demand/original delivery timelines. We stand with them in not compromising quality just to finish your sweaters sooner. They’re working as quick as they can to get sweaters delivered to us, in order for us to finish sending them out to you.

Happy Thursday Backers!
We’re excited to let you know that our first batch of “February” Libre sweaters have arrived in the warehouse and our team is finalizing getting those in inventory so that we get your sweaters out. To make sure that everyone is taken care of and to minimize any mistakes, we will be processing this large shipment of sweaters (~2,000 Libres) in smaller batches over the next few days and in the order that they were received on Kickstarter. Shipments will start today.

Hi Backers,
We hope that this message finds you all well and ready for your weekend! Here's the latest news from our team and the delivery of your Libre sweaters.
A small batch of sweaters arrived in our warehouse over the last week and were sent out to remaining December backers. There are still several December backers that are affected due to a few sizes being out of stock, but your order is in our system and your sweater will be sent out immediately as soon as this next batch of sweaters arrives. If you are a December backer and have questions regarding the status of your delivery, please email llamas@cotopaxi.com.

Happy Friday, Backers!
We just heard from our factory last night and have finally received a shipping update for February deliveries and the December shortage. First, the December units should be arriving to our warehouses in the next 1-2 weeks and will be sent out then. The good news on February sweaters is that all “February” sweaters should be arriving in our warehouses during the month of February. The not so good news is that it will be near the end of February due to some technical problems with a few pieces of machinery, reducing the factories knitting capacity. It is longer than we were expecting/hoping for, but they’re coming and we’re committed to do the best we can to get them out to you as quickly as possible. This includes air shipping units from Bolivia instead of traditional ground/ocean transportation, saving several weeks. We know that many of you can’t wait to get your sweaters!

Hi Backers,
We just sent out an update specific for EU backers, but want to update everyone else on what’s going on here at Cotopaxi and with Libre Sweaters. We’ve been communicating with December backers via email since the first shipment arrived last month. The good news is that ~90% of December sweaters were sent out and delivered. The not-so-llamazing news from December is that we did not receive the complete order from our factory in Bolivia. After doing an inventory count, it appeared there was a small shortage on a few sizes. Luckily, we had some rockstar backers who opted to receive their sweaters at a later date. We are still working to get this resolved and these backers will be taken care of as soon as more sweaters arrive. All future sweater deliveries (February, March, and April deliveries) will happen in the order that they came into Kickstarter and Indiegogo.

Hi EU Backers! (Another update for all backers coming soon)
We’ve been communicating with you through email updates recently, but wanted to post here so that everyone knows what’s going on. Mid-late December our shipment arrived in Germany and was held up by customs. Unfortunately it was out of our control. Next, it appears that the courier service had been holding our packages and not updated tracking due to an issue with the new account set up. That seems to be resolved now and we should have tracking start updating today and packages moving. You should have received, or will receive a tracking link via your email linked to your Kickstarter account. If you have not received a tracking link for your sweater by Wednesday, 1/25, please contact llamas@cotopaxi.com and our team will get that for you as soon as they can. As mentioned in our email updates to December backers, your Amazon gift cards are also being issued to the email linked to your Kickstarter account.

Hi Backers,
We’re excited to say that December Libre sweaters left our factory in Bolivia yesterday (12/13) and are still on track for holiday delivery. We have left surveys open for backers outside of the EU until Friday at 12 PM Mountain Time. You can access your survey at libre.backerkit.com (with your Kickstarter email address) and make any necessary changes if needed. If you have any questions, or are in the EU and have questions, please contact our customer experience team by emailing llamas@cotopaxi.com.

Hey Backers,
Surveys will be sent out by BackerKit at any time now, so you should be seeing them in your inbox shortly. If you don't see it tonight or tomorrow morning, check your spam folder, and keep checking back.
In this survey, you're going to tell us:

campaign.story:
Project Latitude | A Brand That Belongs to Those Who Need It
Over the last few years, we have spent our vacations building homes in under-developed areas across the world on volunteer-build trips.  All the trips we have done in the past relied on us as volunteers to come up with large amounts of funds, typically asking our family and friends, to finance the project. Also, our impact on these trips was limited to building a single house for one family. Project Latitude is our solution to the following problems:
1. How could we make volunteering trips more affordable?
2. How could we have a more lasting presence in these communities?
The concept is simple: Our products are tied to a community for as long as they are sold. The community will inspire the product design, make the products and they will be the sole recipients of the funds raised from the sales.
Each project will have a fundraising goal. We are architects, so every project will respond to the communities’ construction needs. Since this particular project is a build, let's say it's a certain amount of bricks needed to be raised. Every product we sell will count towards this fundraising goal.
Each product is tied to the community for its lifetime. So when we start a new project, it will be with an entirely new line of products – based on the culture of this new community.
Because of everyone’s support on Project Latitude’s Kickstarter, we were able to donate 1200 liters of water to the Ecuador Earthquake relief efforts. The water was donated earlier this week in Canoa, Ecuador and came at a critical time for the community.
Our first product is the result of a trip to Ecuador, where we were inspired by the Andean culture and lifestyle. We fell in love with the rich colors and textures of the local fabric, which inspired us to design a backpack to help raise our funds.
The Chaski Backpack is an all-purpose roll-top backpack designed for people like us, one that could be used in the city AND on adventurous weekend getaways. 
Each Chaski is individually handmade in Ecuador.  Chaski means messenger in Quichua - the local Andean language.
Roll-Top Style Backpack
Local Material Shoulder Strap Detailing
Exterior Pockets for Everyday Essentials
All Detailing is made from 100% Recycled Car Tires
Padded Interior Laptop Compartment
Vertical Front Pocket Accessible While Backpack is on Shoulder
Rubber Bottom with Unique Pattern from Recycled Car Tires
AustriAlpin Quick-Release Buckle
Handwoven Interior Lining and Accent Strap
Multiple Strap Colors Available
All products are stamped with the latitude coordinate where the product is from. The Chaski has 00 for Ecuador.
Anyone can track the impact the sales are making as well as track the overall progress of the project on our website. Each product will also come with a tag about the members of the community.
Our hope is to create a brand that will ultimately impact communities across Latin America by rethinking the way volunteer projects are funded.
While many other companies offer to donate a portion of their proceeds to a good cause, Project Latitude actually takes the funds - or bricks in this case - and builds the project!
With the help of volunteers, Project 00 will build an entrepreneur workshop in the community of La Isla outside Quito, Ecuador. This will provide the community with much needed space for production, which in turn will empower the workers and the community as a whole.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are architects/designers - we have full confidence in the process of designing the products as well as organizing the physical build. Bag production is new to us, but we've been working with the manufacturers for close to a year. We've adjusted the backpack's design many times to arrive at our final product. Despite best intentions, manufacturing complications and delays can occur when dealing with overseas logistics. We will make sure to notify all our backers of any changes in the delivery process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Tikr is an interactive treat toy that will surprise and delight your doggy pal for prolonged periods of time. Fill tikr with treats, then set the length of playtime by turning the built-in timer dial. There are NO electronics to break, and NO batteries to charge or even replace. Yup, you read that right!
Fill with Treats!
Set the timer from 5-45 minutes
Playtime!
Playtime can be as short as 5 minutes, or as long as 45. You decide! 
Tikr rewards your dog's play and curiosity with gradual access to the treats inside. 
Treats can only fall out when the timer-controlled holes in the toy align, so your dog remains captivated throughout play.
The treat holes are different sizes, so larger treats are saved until the very end. First the small, then the medium, and finally the large treat!
Oh, and did we mention... no batteries or charging required!
Tikr is made of incredibly tough rubber that is safe on teeth and won’t make that loud rattling sound that hard plastic toys do.
Help us reach 1,001 backers and free tikr treats unlock for all backers! Tikr treats are the perfect size for tikr, healthy, and all-natural. Help spread the word!
The idea for tikr came from playing with our dogs Misha and Aure. Our dogs love to play. But unfortunately, nothing on the market was keeping their attention for more than a few minutes at best. They needed a stimulating, long-lasting dog toy that would spark their natural curiosity. And we wanted a safe, healthy and affordable solution... 
So, we came up with tikr!
Our concept was to use a timer to MAXIMIZE the time that treats were captured by the toy. This would ultimately ensure that playtime would last. I took the idea to d:e Creative to transform it from concept to reality...
Some of my early sketches
Together we developed tikr to be the ULTIMATE solution: a super fun interactive dog toy that rewards your pup's attention with treats, and can keep them engaged for an amazingly long period of time - over and over again!
Early CAD screenshots
All dogs rejoice... it's a hit!
Tikr's patent pending secret is the built-in timer combined with varying hole sizes. As the timer unwinds, the hole in the treat chamber slowly aligns with the increasingly bigger holes in the outer shell. When the inner hole aligns with the outer holes, the treats are awarded through play. Larger treats remain inside tikr (until the time is right) because they can't fit through the smaller holes. 
It's really that simple!
X-Ray view shows the treat chamber rotating - in super quick time!
We're designing special tikr treats that will be the ideal size. But, you can totally use any treats or kibble your dog likes! Keep the play experience exciting by varying the timer settings, or amount of treats used.
Tikr is made from a food safe rubber-like blend that's flexible, extremely durable, and easy on your dog's teeth. It uses no electronics or batteries.
tikr size compared with a standard tennis ball
Tikr has been our labor of love for the last two-and-a-half years. The design has been perfected and dogs absolutely love playing with tikr!  Production is nearly ready, and we've come to you, the Kickstarter community, to help us make tikr a reality for dog lovers everywhere. 
Tooling has been very costly, and we want to make a sizable order with the factory in order to keep the costs low for everyone.  So please, for treats sake, back tikr today! 
Thank you for your support!
- The Christensen Family (Misha, Amanda, Maddox, Whit & Aure)
                                                                         We're super excited!
Launch Kickstarter Campaign
Successfully funded! High-Fives all around!
Expect the unexpected
Conquer the unexpected
Begin treat production
Place initial order with our factory
Prepare tikr for factory shipment
Head for the open seas
Begin shipping tikr to backers!
All dogs unite... IT'S PAWDY TIME!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are challenges in any product design process. Fortunately, we've already worked through many of them. We've spent a great deal of time and energy perfecting tikr through numerous prototypes and testing phases. The design and tooling is finalized, and from here forward our challenges will be focused on production and logistics. We've chosen a very experienced and professional factory, and are working closely with them to ensure top quality on all of our production parts. We will also work tirelessly and do our very best to adhere to the timeline set forth. We believe in transparency and will continue to communicate clearly with our backers about any issue that may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We had a vision from the very start. We believe that there needs to be a fashionable and functional alternative for climbing footwear. This is where our journey began, and has now surpassed what we thought was even possible. In the end, we created an authentic shoe line full of classic, distinctive qualities. Let’s Take Hold together.      
     Early in the process, we committed to blending fashion and function. The colors, style, and nostalgia of retro footwear drove our simple obsession. Pulling inspiration from vintage running shoes, retro soccer shoes, and bowling shoes, we slowly began turning these inspirational concepts into high performance climbing shoes. 
     We pioneered along-side an innovative designer from France and began to tackle the mountains ahead. Every part of each shoe has been meticulously designed. The external features of the shoes distinctively resemble the classic footwear that originally inspired us.  
     Our development process resulted in over 150 samples. Although a daunting and lengthy process, only extended by our fierce and stubborn determination to develop originality and a timeless aesthetic, not a single detail was overlooked.
     Between our ingenuity and final world-class samples, 1,095 days have passed. That is three years of defying the odds and building our vision. 36 months of creating a product that is stylish, unprecedented, and innovative.
     We want to build these shoes together, and offer you a deep discount as an early pioneer. We are not owned by a parent company or conglomerate.  We don't have big investors, and are completely independent. Yet, you have helped make us identifiable in the world of climbing, for which we are incredibly grateful. We are excited to bring you a future of innovative grips, clothing, and footwear. Thank you and enjoy.
      In our pursuit for a rubber that exceeded the standard, we discovered one formulated for the United States Navy Seals. The rubber was built for a purpose. This outsole rubber provided security for the Navy Seals, assuring that their feet would not slip during rugged approaches.
     We signed a licensing agreement, and began to incorporate the innovative rubber into our shoes. This tenacious rand and outsole rubber is called “Dark Matter", and is a member of the "UnParallel Rubber" family. Its signature is denoted with a simple line placed on the bottom of each shoe.
     Our functional colored outsole rubber is the first of it’s kind, ever. Several models are the only climbing shoes, ever created, devoid of the monotonous black outsole. The creation of both a sticky and colored outsole rubber provides a perfect combination of fashion, function, and performance.
     Inspired by a retro running shoe, the Runner embodies simple aspects of classic footwear while retaining the functionality of a high-performance climbing shoe. A medium stiffness, highly downturned toe provides precision in technical or steep overhung climbing. The fish-hook, thin midsole helps edging power for gym and outdoor climbing.
     The padded tongue, breathable mesh upper, and thin lining offers comfort and reliability. Crafted with synthetic materials to create a long lasting fit (minimal stretch) and three point velcro closure system, the Runner is a supreme climbing shoe blending fashion and function.
Learn More

A medium stiffness highly downturned toe provides precision in technical or steep overhung climbing. The fish-hook, thin midsole helps edging power for gym and outdoor climbing.
     The padded tongue, breathable mesh upper, and thin lining offers comfort and reliability. Crafted with synthetic materials to create a long lasting fit (minimal stretch) and three point velcro closure system, the Runner is a supreme climbing shoe blending fashion and function. The LV (Low Volume) version is for a narrower, thinner foot.
Learn More
     Inspired by everyday classic footwear, the Street is a faultless blend of fashion and function. The softest and most downturned aggressive shoe in the line was designed with synthetic materials for minimal stretch. An ultra thin midsole proves a softer, more sensitive feel, creating an extremely lightweight, aggressive climbing shoe.
     The Street is fully sealed in a formidable matte black finish and equipped with a thin, padded tongue. The toe box has been masterfully crafted to allow for a higher level of comfort and works conjunctively with the perfect amount of tension in the heel. The larger matte black buckles give the tightening system power and sensitivity to mold the soft shoe to your foot.
Learn More
     Designed to resemble a retro 70’s bowling shoe, the Bowler mimics similar characteristics in style. Adorned in vintage details, the Bowler is an original climbing shoe intended for beginners with a less aggressive, classic shape. Produced with a supremely thick midsole for durability, ultra thick rand, and leather upper for extreme comfort, the Bowler is something cool for beginner climbers.        
Learn More
     Modeled after a 1970’s retro soccer shoe, the Kick is a uniquely crafted climbing shoe. A perfect companion for intermediate climbers, the shape is slightly arched and perfectly tensioned in the heel. Developed with comfort and function in mind, the medium stiffness midsole helps enable the shoe retain its clean shape.
     The Kick is dyed leather with custom colors, soaking them in rich tones creates an unprecedented original shoe. Perfect for bouldering, gym training, and outdoor climbing, the Kick blurs the lines between comfort and performance. The Kick boasts a simple, single strap, velcro closure system for quick on and off capabilities.
